turn.2: Alice Zorn Alice Zorn is a Canadian author.
turn.4: Originally from Hamilton, Ontario, Zorn now lives in Montreal, Quebec.
turn.5: What is she best known for?
turn.6: She is known as the author of various short stories published in a wide variety of Canadian magazines, as well as the collection of short stories "Ruins & Relics" (2009) and the novels "Arrhythmia" (2011) and "Five Roses" (2016).
turn.7: What magazines has she been published in?
turn.8: Zorn has published pieces of fiction in magazines including "The New Quarterly", "Room of One's Own", and "Grain".
turn.9: Has any of her short stories won awards?
turn.10: One of her stories placed first in the "Prairie Fire" fiction contest in 2006 and 2011.
turn.11: What other awards has she won?
turn.12: Her first book, "Ruins & Relics", a short story collection published by NeWest Press in March 2009, was a finalist for the 2009 Quebec Writers' Federation's McAuslan First Book Prize.
